Administration.text:
Type:
Diabetes medication
Dosage Forms: 15 mg, 30 mg, 45 mg
Routes of Administration: PO
Common Trade Names: Actos

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
>15-30 mg PO qd
Start with 15 mg PO qd
Max: 45 mg/day
Give with metformin

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: No recommended
Renal Dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic Dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Pediatric patients <15 yo
Type 1 diabetes
DKA
Active bladder cancer
CHF
(symptomatic; NYHA Class III-IV)

Caution.text:
CHF
(NYHA Class I-II)
CHF
Risk
Edema
Hepatic impairment
Bladder cancer history
Premenopausal anovulatory patients

Serious.text:
CHF
Hepatotoxicity
Diabetic macular edema
Bladder cancer risk
Fractures (females)

Common.text:
URI
Headache
Myalgia
Weight gain
Edema
Fluid retention
Flatulence
Anemia
Ovulation induction

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 3-7 hrs; 16-24 hrs (metabolites)
Metabolism: Liver (CYP450)
Excretion: Urine; bile
